sen.j: 検注帳（けんちゅうちょう）とは、古代・中世の日本の荘園において検注の結果を集計して取りまとめた帳簿のこと。
sen.e: Kenchucho refers to ledgers for recording the results of kenchu (land surveys) in shoen (manors) during the ancient and medieval times in Japan.
The word Kenchucho refers to ledgers for recording the results of kenchu (land surveys) in shoen (manors) during ancient and medieval times in Japan.
Kenchucho refers to ledgers for recording the results of kenchu (land surveys) in shoen (manors) during ancient and medieval times in Japan.

sen.j: 検注が古代の検田を引き継ぐことから検田帳（けんでんちょう）と呼ばれていたほか、実検帳（じつけんちょう）・丸帳（まるちょう）・馬上帳（ばじょうちょう）とも。
sen.e: Since kenchu originated from kenden (cadastral surveys), kenchucho was also called kendencho, jikkencho, marucho, and bajocho.
Since kenchu originated from kenden (cadastral surveys), kenchucho was also called kendencho, jikkencho, marucho, and bajocho.

Since kenchu originated from kenden (cadastral surveys), kenchucho was also called kendencho (ledger of kenden), jikkencho (ledger of survey), marucho (ledger of round), and bajocho (ledger of hourseback).

sen.j: 荘園制において荘園領主が土地・人民を支配するための基本台帳としての役目を果たした。
sen.e: It functioned as residents' ledgers in order for the shoen owners to manage the lands and people.
They functioned as residents' ledgers in order for the shoen owners to manage their lands and people.
They functioned as residents' ledgers in order for the shoen owners to manage their lands and people.

sen.j: 検注帳は荘園によって形式の違いがあるものの、大まかには耕地の一筆もしくは1坪単位の所在地、面積、所定の租税量、名請人などを書き上げ最後に項目ごとにまとめた集計を載せる。
sen.e: Although there are differences in forms between different shoen, in general, kenchucho records, in regard to a unit, or 3.3 sq.m. of the cultivation fields, the address, dimension, given amount of tax from the land, and the name of naukenin (cultivator assigned to the piece of land), as well as the tally for each item inserted in the last part.

Although there are differences in methods between different manors, in general, kenchucho records, in regard to a unit of 3.3 sq.m. of cultivated field, the address, dimensions, given amount of tax from the land, and the name of naukenin (cultivator assigned to the piece of land), as well as the tally for each item inserted at the end.

Although there are differences in methods between different manors, in general, kenchucho records, in regard to a unit of 3.3 sq.m. of cultivated field, the address, dimensions, given amount of tax from the land, and the name of naukenin (cultivator assigned to the piece of land), as well as the tally for each item inserted at the end.

sen.j: そして検注の実施年月日と「注進如件」の書止を記し、荘園領主から派遣された検注使と在地の荘官、場合によっては地頭が連署した。
sen.e: It was concluded with the date when kenchu was carried out and a round-up phrase "chushin kudan no gotoshi"(the case is thus reported as above) as well as the signatures of kenchushi (land surveyor) dispatched by the shoen owner, the local shokan (an officer entrusted with local management by the shoen owner), and in some cases, of jito (an estate steward).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was carried out on the same date the kenchu was carried out and the established words "chushin kudan no gotoshi" (the case is thus reported as above) as well as the signatures of the kenchushi (land surveyor) were dispatched by the manor owner, the local shokan (an officer entrusted with local management by the manor owner), and in some cases, jito (estate steward);

It was carried out on the same date the kenchu was carried out and the established words 'chushin kudan no gotoshi' (the case is thus reported as above) as well as the signatures of the kenchushi (land surveyor) were dispatched by the manor owner, the local shokan (an officer entrusted with local management by the manor owner), and in some cases, jito (estate steward).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション、セミコロンを変えました。

sen.j: 合わせて2部作成し、1部は荘官が在地での荘務のために用い、もう1部は荘園領主が年貢・公事の徴収の際に用いた。
sen.e: Two copies of kenchucho were made; one copy for the use of shokan for conducting managerial duties in the local shoen, and the other for the shoen owner for determining the amount of nengu (land tax) and kuji (public duties) to be imposed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: two copies of kenchucho were made: one copy for the use of the shokan for conducting managerial duties in the local manor, and the other for the manor owner for determining the amount of nengu (land tax) and kuji (public duties).

Two copies of kenchucho were made: One copy for the use of the shokan for conducting managerial duties in the local manor, and the other for the manor owner for determining the amount of nengu (land tax) and kuji (public duties).

sen.j: だが、検注帳作成に必要な紙代をはじめとして勘料と呼ばれる検注にかかった事務経費や検注使を在地に迎えた際に行われる三日厨などの経費は全て在地の負担とされたために検注を忌避する動きも強かったため、実際に検注を行い検注帳作成に至らなかった場合もあったと言われている。
sen.e: However, it is said that there were some cases in which although kenchu was carried out, kenchucho was not made, due to the fact that the administration cost called kenryo including the cost of papers used to make kenchucho, as well as the cost of mikkakuriya (three-day banquet) which was held when they received kenchushi in their land, was all defrayed by the local administration.

However, it is said that there were some cases where although the kenchu was carried out, the kenchucho was not carried out due to the fact that the administration costs called kenryo including the cost of paper used to make kenchucho, as well as the cost of the mikkakuriya (three-day banquet) which was held when they received kenchushi in their land, was all defrayed by the local administration.
sen.cmt: Changed for clarity, grammar, punctuation. "Kenchushi needs an English explanation.
sen.e: However, it is said that there were some cases where although the kenchu was carried out, the kenchucho was not carried out due to the fact that the administration costs called kenryo including the cost of paper used to make kenchucho, as well as the cost of the mikkakuriya (three-day banquet) which was held when they received kenchushi in their land, was all defrayed by the local administration.

sen.j: なお、荘園の四至牓示や公領・荘園を問わず一国平均役などを徴収する場合などは国司による検注も行われ、検注状が作成された。
sen.e: In addition, when ikkoku heikinyaku (taxes and labor uniformly imposed on shoen and kokugaryo (provincial land) in a province) was imposed regardless of Shiishiboji (notices on every corner of shoryo (territory) in order to clarify the boundaries) of shoen or whether the land is public (koryo) or private (shoen), kenchu by kokushi(an officer of local government) was carried out, and kenchujo (report of kenchu) was issued.

In addition, when ikkoku heikinyaku (taxes and labor uniformly imposed on manors and provincial land in a province) were imposed regardless of shiishiboji (notices on every corner of the territory in order to clarify the boundaries) of manors or whether the land is public (koryo) or private manors, kenchu by kokushi (an officer of local government) was carried out, and kenchujo (the report of the kenchu) was issued.
sen.cmt: There are two many words in Japanese with an English explanation. This is confusing to the reader and doesn't add any extra meaning.
sen.e: In addition, when ikkoku heikinyaku (taxes and labor uniformly imposed on manors and provincial land in a province) were imposed regardless of shiishiboji (notices on every corner of the territory in order to clarify the boundaries) of manors or whether the land is public (koryo) or private manors, kenchu by kokushi (an officer of local government) was carried out, and kenchujo (the report of the kenchu) was issued.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 検注に際して検注帳の他に「検注目録」「名寄帳」「内検帳」などが合わせて作成され、検注帳を補完する役目を担った。
sen.e: In addition to kenchucho, documents such as "kenchumokuroku,""nayosecho," and "naikencho" was made in order to supplement kenchucho.
In addition to kenchucho, documents such as "kenchumokuroku,""nayosecho," and "naikencho" were made in order to supplement kenchucho.

In addition to kenchucho, documents such as 'kenchu mokuroku' (A land register for shoen or public lands), 'nayosecho' (village register of land survey), and 'naikencho' (Reports of the land damage caused by natural disasters) were made in order to supplement kenchucho.

sen.j: 検注目録（けんちゅうもくろく）は、検注帳の明細にあたる文書で荘園領主の元で保管されて土地支配や徴税の際の参考にされた。
sen.e: Kenchumokuroku was an accounting document of kenchucho which was kept by the shoen owners for the purpose of governing their lands and imposing taxes.
Kenchumokuroku was an accounting document in the kenchucho which was kept by the manor owners for the purpose of governing their lands and imposing taxes.
Kenchu mokuroku was an accounting document in the kenchucho which was kept by the manor owners for the purpose of governing their lands and imposing taxes.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 検注目録を別個に作らず、検注帳に一括して記載される場合もあったが、反対に検注以外の時に在地において目録との照合・訂正を行って古くなった検地帳の補完を行う場合もあった。
sen.e: There were examples in which kenchumokuroku was incorporated into kenchucho, but on the other hand, there were examples in which kenchumokuroku was made by the local administration separately and especially to supplement kenchucho, which was in need of update and correction by collating with the index when kenchu was not being carried out.

There were examples in which kenchumokuroku was incorporated into the kenchucho, but there were also examples in which kenchumokuroku was made by the local administration separately and especially to supplement the kenchucho, which was in need of update and correction by collating with the index when the kenchu was not being carried out.

There were examples in which kenchu mokuroku was incorporated into the kenchucho, but there were also examples in which kenchu mokuroku was made by the local administration separately and especially to supplement the kenchucho, which was in need of update and correction by collating with the index when the kenchu was not being carried out.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 最初に惣田数と年間可収租税総額を記載して、次に「除田」と「定田」のそれぞれの明細を列記した。
sen.e: In the first part, the total number of rice fields and the total amount of the annual tax to be imposed were written, and in the second part, the details of joden (tax-free rice fields) and teiden (taxable rice fields) were written.

In the first part, the total number of rice fields and the total amount of the annual tax to be imposed were written, and in the second part, the details of joden (tax-free rice fields) and teiden (taxable rice fields) were written.

In the first part, the total number of rice fields and the total amount of the annual tax to be imposed were written, and in the second part, the details of 'joden' (tax-free rice fields) and 'teiden' (taxable rice fields) were written.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: 前者は荒田・仏神田（寺田・神田、その他宗教行事経費）・人給（荘官や地頭など代官の給分）・井料（井戸や用水などの灌漑設備）などが挙げられ、それ以外の後者に対して実際の年貢・公事が賦課されていた。
sen.e: Joden included run-down fields, fields belonged to shrines and temples (including the expense for other religious events),

Joden included run-down fields, fields belonging to shrines and temples (including expenses for other religious events), personnel costs (salaries for local governors such as shokan and jito), and the cost of water (irrigation facilities such as wells and irrigation channels).
sen.cmt: Sentence split is nonsensical, so I have split it in a way which doesn't affect the meaning.
sen.e: The former included run-down fields, fields belonging to shrines and temples (including expenses for other religious events), personnel costs (salaries for local governors such as shokan and jito), and the cost of water (irrigation facilities such as wells and irrigation channels), while the latter, categorized as the rest, was the basis on which nengu and kuji were imposed.
sen.cmt: 原文が2行にまたがっていたので訳と共に統合しました。

sen.j: 名寄帳（なよせちょう）は検注帳や検注目録が土地を基準にして集計しているのに対して、名請人ごとに田地を集計した帳簿である。
sen.e: Nayosecho was an accounting document which tallied the cultivation fields according to each naukenin, as opposed to kenchucho and kenchumokuroku which tallied according to the units of lands.

Nayosecho was an accounting document which tallied the information on the cultivated fields according to each naukenin, as opposed to kenchucho and kenchumokuroku which tallied according to the number of units of the land.

Nayosecho was an accounting document which tallied the information on the cultivated fields according to each naukenin, as opposed to kenchucho and kenchumokuroku which tallied according to the number of units of the land.

sen.j: 荘官が保管して年貢・公事などの負担割当に決定するのに用いられたが、荘園によっては荘園領主に提出される場合もあった。
sen.e: It was kept by shokan in order to determine the amount of nengu and role allotment of kuji; in some cases, it was submitted to the shoen owner.
It was kept by the shokan in order to determine the amount of nengu and the role allotment of kuji; in some cases, it was submitted to the manor owner.
It was kept by the shokan in order to determine the amount of nengu and the role allotment of kuji; in some cases, it was submitted to the manor owner.

sen.j: 内検帳（ないけんちょう）は、風水害などの災害にあって収穫の減少が見込まれる地域においてその状況を調査した帳簿である。
sen.e: Naikencho was a document which reported the situation of the areas where, due to severe damages caused by natural disasters such as floods or typhoon, a decrease of the harvest was to be expected.
Naikencho was a document which reported the situation in the areas where, due to severe damage caused by natural disasters such as floods and typhoons, a decrease of the harvest was to be expected.
Naikencho was a document which reported the situation in the areas where, due to severe damage caused by natural disasters such as floods and typhoons, a decrease of the harvest was to be expected.

sen.j: 災害発生時に被害地域を対象に臨時に行われる検注の際に作成された。
sen.e: It was made when an emergency chenchu on the damaged areas was carried out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was made when an emergency kenchu on the damaged areas was carried out.
It was made when an emergency kenchu on the damaged areas was carried out.

sen.j: 収穫不可な「損田」と収穫可能な「得田」に分類して在地における見込み租税額などを算定・記載した。
sen.e: In it, they divided the fields between "sonden"(damaged fields) from which harvest could not be expected and "tokuden"(productive fields) from which harvest could be expected, and calculated and recorded the expected amount of tax to be imposed on the local area.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In it, they divided the fields between "sonden"(damaged fields) from which harvest could not be expected and "tokuden"(productive fields) from which harvest could be expected, and calculated and recorded the expected amount of tax to be imposed on the local area.

In it, they divided the fields between 'sonden' (damaged fields) from which harvest could not be expected and 'tokuden' (productive fields) from which harvest could be expected, and calculated and recorded the expected amount of tax to be imposed on the local area.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。
